verses.text: And the children of Israel set forward , and pitched in the plains of Moab on this side Jordan \add by\add* Jericho. \p
¶ And Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
And Moab was sore afraid of the people , because they \add were\add* many : and Moab was distressed because of the children of Israel.

And Moab said unto the elders of Midian , Now shall this company lick up all \add that are\add* round about us, as the ox licketh up the grass of the field. And Balak the son of Zippor \add was\add* king of the Moabites at that time.

He sent messengers therefore unto Balaam the son of Beor to Pethor , which \add is\add* by the river of the land of the children of his people , to call him, saying , Behold, there is a people come out from Egypt : behold, they cover the face of the earth , and they abide over against me:\f + \fr 22.5 \ft face: Heb. eye\f*

Come now therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people ; for they \add are\add* too mighty for me: peradventure I shall prevail , \add that\add* we may smite them, and \add that\add* I may drive them out of the land : for I wot that he whom thou blessest \add is\add* blessed , and he whom thou cursest is cursed.
And the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the rewards of divination in their hand ; and they came unto Balaam , and spake unto him the words of Balak.
And he said unto them, Lodge here this night , and I will bring you word again , as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall speak unto me: and the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.
And God came unto Balaam , and said , What men \add are\add* these with thee?
And Balaam said unto God , Balak the son of Zippor , king of Moab , hath sent unto me, \add saying\add*,

Behold, \add there is\add* a people come out of Egypt , which covereth the face of the earth : come now, curse me them; peradventure I shall be able to overcome them, and drive them out.\f + \fr 22.11 \ft I shall…: Heb. I shall prevail in fighting against him\f*
And God said unto Balaam , Thou shalt not go with them; thou shalt not curse the people : for they \add are\add* blessed.
And Balaam rose up in the morning , and said unto the princes of Balak , Get you into your land : for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* refuseth to give me leave to go with you.
And the princes of Moab rose up , and they went unto Balak , and said , Balaam refuseth to come with us. \p
¶ And Balak sent yet again princes , more , and more honourable than they.

And they came to Balaam , and said to him, Thus saith Balak the son of Zippor , Let nothing, I pray thee, hinder thee from coming unto me:\f + \fr 22.16 \ft Let…: Heb. Be not thou hindered from, etc\f*
For I will promote thee unto very great honour , and I will do whatsoever thou sayest unto me: come therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people.

And Balaam answered and said unto the servants of Balak , If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold , I cannot go beyond the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* my God , to do less or more.
Now therefore, I pray you, tarry ye also here this night , that I may know what the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will say unto me more.
And God came unto Balaam at night , and said unto him, If the men come to call thee, rise up , \add and\add* go with them; but yet the word which I shall say unto thee, that shalt thou do.
And Balaam rose up in the morning , and saddled his ass , and went with the princes of Moab. \p

¶ And God’s anger was kindled because he went : and the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* stood in the way for an adversary against him. Now he was riding upon his ass , and his two servants \add were\add* with him.

And the ass saw the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* standing in the way , and his sword drawn in his hand : and the ass turned aside out of the way , and went into the field : and Balaam smote the ass , to turn her into the way.
But the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* stood in a path of the vineyards , a wall \add being\add* on this side, and a wall on that side.
And when the ass saw the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, she thrust herself unto the wall , and crushed Balaam’s foot against the wall : and he smote her again.
And the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* went further , and stood in a narrow place , where \add was\add* no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.
And when the ass saw the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, she fell down under Balaam : and Balaam’s anger was kindled , and he smote the ass with a staff.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* opened the mouth of the ass , and she said unto Balaam , What have I done unto thee, that thou hast smitten me these three times ?
And Balaam said unto the ass , Because thou hast mocked me: I would there were a sword in mine hand , for now would I kill thee.

And the ass said unto Balaam , \add Am\add* not I thine ass , upon which thou hast ridden ever since \add I was\add* thine unto this day ? was I ever wont to do so unto thee? And he said , Nay.\f + \fr 22.30 \ft upon…: Heb. who hast ridden upon me\f*\f + \fr 22.30 \ft ever since…: or, ever since thou wast, etc\f*

Then the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* opened the eyes of Balaam , and he saw the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* standing in the way , and his sword drawn in his hand : and he bowed down his head, and fell flat on his face.  +  r 22.31  t fell…: or, bowed himself *

And the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto him, Wherefore hast thou smitten thine ass these three times ? behold, I went out to withstand thee, because \add thy\add* way is perverse before me:\f + \fr 22.32 \ft to…: Heb. to be an adversary unto thee\f*
And the ass saw me, and turned from me these three times : unless she had turned from me , surely now also I had slain thee, and saved her alive.

And Balaam said unto the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I have sinned ; for I knew not that thou stoodest in the way against me: now therefore, if it displease thee , I will get me back again.\f + \fr 22.34 \ft displease…: Heb. be evil in thine eyes\f*

And the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Balaam , Go with the men : but only the word that I shall speak unto thee, that thou shalt speak. So Balaam went with the princes of Balak. \p
¶ And when Balak heard that Balaam was come , he went out to meet him unto a city of Moab , which \add is\add* in the border of Arnon , which \add is\add* in the utmost coast.
And Balak said unto Balaam , Did I not earnestly send unto thee to call thee? wherefore camest thou not unto me? am I not able indeed to promote thee to honour ?
And Balaam said unto Balak , Lo, I am come unto thee: have I now any power at all to say any thing ? the word that God putteth in my mouth , that shall I speak.
And Balaam went with Balak , and they came unto Kirjath-huzoth.\f + \fr 22.39 \ft Kirjath-huzoth: or, a city of streets\f*
And Balak offered oxen and sheep , and sent to Balaam , and to the princes that \add were\add* with him.
And it came to pass on the morrow , that Balak took Balaam , and brought him up into the high places of Baal , that thence he might see the utmost \add part\add* of the people.
